Reason: The 'periodic_commitlog_sync_lag_block_in_ms' configuration is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the system performance by determining the amount of time to block writes during slow disk flushes. This configuration involves time-extensive operations within the PeriodicCommitLogService class, where it calculates the expected sync time based on the configured block time. If the block time is set too long, it can significantly slow down write operations, leading to increased latency and impacting the overall system performance at the system level.
